titleStmt.title: The head is generally satisfactory
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: Complete Poems and Prose
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839â€“1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

body.p: The head is generally satisfactory & even fine—the main mar is "the top–knot & Romeo Italian curls" (as a cynical person here calls it all) at the crest of the head & toward the forehead—Can this be combed out (so to speak) more in consonance with the copy? —Some hair should be left there brushed back—but not in a top knot or Italian curls—which are not now & never were worn in that way—If remedied, corrected, it should be done with great delicacy—not to spoil it as existing. WW leaves it to you muchly—& thanks you all for the taste & care & success already achieved
body.note:
Written
by Walt Whitman } Oct. 14, 1888
See notes that date
N. L. T..
